alert.note: Alert for Northeast Mountains (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 08 at 8:38PM PST until January 09 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 9 inches in the valleys. Mountains above 3500 feet 10 to 18 inches of snow. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph Tuesday in the mountains. * WHERE...Orin-Rice Road, Northport, Fruitland, Ione, Metaline Falls, Colville, Springdale-Hunters Road, Tiger, Deer Park, Kettle Falls, Newport, Metaline, Flowery Trail Road, and Chewelah. * WHEN...Until 10 PM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions will impact travel Monday night and Tuesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The bulk of the snow accumulations will occur through 7 AM Tuesday. However snow showers and patchy blowing snow can be expected into the afternoon and evening.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest travel information in Washington, go to https://wsdot.wa.gov/travel
